intro: Raveniopsis aracaensis, commonly known as the Aracaense Raveniopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety purple flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. It is known for its unique floral structure, which includes showy bracts that resemble petals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
